newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile July retail sales rise 3.2 pct on 1995.
newsitem.headline: Chile July retail sales rise 3.2 pct on 1995.

text.p: Chilean retail sales rose 3.2 percent in July compared with the same period last year, said Alfonso Mujica, president of the National Chamber of Commerce.

July's sales growth is sharply off the 4.9 increase recorded in June and shows that "the adjustment which the economy is suffering is being reflected strongly and rapidly in trade (sales)," said Mujica.
He said the slowdown in sales is sign of the cooling in consumer spending growth in the sector.
Various economic indicators, ranging from inflation to supermarket sales, have suggested the Chilean economy is hitting a "soft landing" after strong growth in the first half of the year.

Mujica said the strongest growth in July retail sales was in apparel and footwear, which rose 13 percent and 26 percent, respectively, while furniture sales posted the sharpest drop. They tumbled 20 percent.
